page.title: 07ABBOTSHOLME SCHOOL
page.content: Abbotsholme is an informal co-educational Independent Secondary school, founded by Cecil Reddie in 1888 as a progressive school. The school was not purpose built as it was originally a large house. This has been extended and now includes 15 major buildings,three of which are boardind houses.Inbetween the buildings their is a Roseyard used for socialising,like Bemrose Court which has a giant sized Draughts set and board.The school grounds cover 130 acres,which encompasses the school farm and animals including pigs,cows, horses,sheep and chickens,the schools own sewage works and outdoor swimming pool.At present the school has 30 full-time teaching staff and 250 pupils,54 of which are foreign pupils. The girls and junior boys live at school,the rest in houses in Rocester.
